News: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Drama Drama News & Events Box Office About The Program How To Apply Faculty Administration Student Center Production Resource Office Production Archive High School Programs Summer in Drama Alumni FAQ  home > Drama > News            For department or program events, please visit the Calendar page .  Drama News & Events  FollowSpot Newsletter - Fall 2014 10/20/2014 - Hot off the presses! The Tisch Drama FollowSpot newsletter is now available! Check it out here! More  Building Your Brand 09/18/2014 - A panel discussion with industry professionals (Agents, Managers, Directors, Actors, and Designers) on how to market yourself as a theater artist (headshots, resumes, portfolios, websites, and more). More  Department of Drama Faculty Employment Opportunities 09/01/2014 - The Department of Drama, Tisch School of the Arts at New York University invites applications for open faculty positions. More  Future Theatre Artists Program 09/01/2014 - New FREE program for High School Students!  Part of the Tisch Future Artists Program, the Future Theatre Artists Program - a fourteen-week workshop will be held in the spring of 2015. Click here for more details and the application! More top International Theatre Workshop - Amsterdam 2014 07/23/2014 - Department of Drama's recent trip to Amsterdam for the annual International Theatre Workshop - Summer 2014 More  Lilia Rubin to have play produced in Newcastle, UK 03/19/2014 - Graduating Drama student, Lilia Rubin to have her play "The Fall" performed by the graduating class at Northumbria University at Northern Stage, in Newcastle, UK. More  Drama Faculty Anthony Turner Performs in WHO AM I? at LaMama 01/17/2014 - La MaMa Theatre in association with the Foundation for Modern Music presents: Who Am I?   with Drama Faculty Anthony Turner! More  P&D Alum named 2013 Young Designer To Watch 01/06/2014 - Production & Design Studio alum, Jason Sherwood, is named a 2013 Young Designer to Watch! More  Drama Faculty Selected for 2014 BAX Arts Educator Award 01/05/2014 - Drama Faculty Associate Arts Professor Paul Langland selected for 2014 BAX Arts and Artists ProgressArts Educator Award! More top Political Snorts '13 12/01/2013 - NYU/Tisch School of the Arts/Department of Drama/StageWorks Presents: Political Snorts by Liz Swados’ class in Performance Composition: Political Revue Political Snorts is a revue filled with characters songs and sketches that examine,rip apart,and destroy events taking place in our world. The comedy is dangerous so come wearing a vest. More  FollowSpot Newsletter Fall 2013 11/01/2013 - Announcing the fourth issue of the Tisch Drama FollowSpot newsletter! Check it out here! More  A Working Morning 09/01/2013 - The Department of Drama’s "Welcome Week" activities for the Class of 2017 got off to a rousing start. More  Oo-Bla-Dee 03/11/2013 - Set in post-World War II America, Oo-Bla-Dee follows four black female musicians who dream of hitting it big in the world of bebop music. As they strive to find an outlet for their sound, the band of black musicians struggles to rise above the constraints of racism and sexism. More  Ethan Hawke Visits Drama Faculty Cobina Gillitt's Class 03/14/2013 - Ethan Hawke and Jonathan Marc Sherman made a visit to Drama Theatre Studies course "Expressionism and Beyond" on Tuesday, March 5th, to talk about their current production of Clive (retelling of Brecht's Baal) at The New Group in Theatre Row. More  Drama Faculty Catherine Coray Curates SOLITAIRE 03/11/2013 - Solitaire is a multimedia performance connecting 9/11 in the United States to the Egyptian Revolution. The performance documents, dramatically and visually, some of the experiences of Arab Americans post 9/11, and the impact of these events on the Arab World. It also records the early phase of January 25th Revolution in Tahrir Square through the eyes of an Egyptian woman who changes and creates change in her journey to shape her identity and find peace.
